llm.feedback: Your draft is fact‑rich but drifts from a tight, handle‑centric view and repeats generic language. Tighten the causal chain by explicitly linking each catalyst to a canonical handle (e.g., us_inflation → ust10y → dxy) and quantify the impact (e.g., a 2.5 % CPI → +10 bp ust10y → +80 bp dxy). Remove the Japanese M&A paragraph or reframe it as a “minor upside” (≤ 0.5 % dxy lift) to avoid over‑weighting a weak signal. Condense the watch list into a single bullet: “Watch Aug 15 CPI, Sep 17 Fed policy, Sep 11 ECB policy, tariff announcements (Aug 15‑Sep 30) – each can move dxy 50–100 bp.” Replace “persistent war‑risk premium” with a concrete metric (e.g., short‑covering volume or VIX spike) and cite the source. Finally, trim the text to 4–6 concise sentences, each ending with a single inline citation, to meet the executive‑brief style.
